attributes.description: The regulated flow rate of oxygen delivered to the cabin measured in liters per minute.
attributes.name: oxygenFlowRate

attributes.description: Concentration of oxygen provided by the system to ensure passenger safety and comfort.
attributes.name: oxygenConcentration

attributes.description: Supply pressure maintained in the oxygen lines to ensure proper distribution to the cabin.
attributes.name: supplyPressure

attributes.description: Response time for the oxygen system to react to deviations in oxygen levels.
attributes.name: responseTime

attributes.description: Operating altitude range within which the oxygen system maintains optimal performance.
attributes.name: operatingAltitude

designScenario.description: The Oxygen System is a critical component of the aircraftâ€™s environmental control suite, responsible for regulating and delivering precise levels of oxygen to the passenger cabin. It integrates advanced sensor arrays, control units, and redundant delivery mechanisms to ensure consistent oxygen supply under all flight conditions. Designed using state-of-the-art aviation engineering principles, the system provides reliable performance, rapid response to oxygen level deviations, and robust safety features including emergency delivery modes. The design emphasizes modularity, maintainability, and integration with other onboard systems to ensure overall flight safety.
designScenario.name: Oxygen System

details.description: The system shall maintain oxygen concentration levels between 21% and 25% using precision sensor networks and control valves.
In the event of an emergency, the system shall activate a backup delivery mode to increase oxygen flow to allow rapid supplemental oxygen provision.
The Oxygen System shall respond to any deviation in oxygen parameters within 3 seconds to trigger corrective measures.
The system shall include redundant components and fail-safe mechanisms, ensuring continued oxygen supply during sensor or actuator failures.
The design shall provide an intuitive user interface with graphical displays and remote monitoring capabilities to assist flight crew in system status evaluation.
All components shall support modular upgrades and ease of maintenance in accordance with standard aviation practices.

relationships.description: The Oxygen Control Unit aggregates real-time data from the Oxygen Sensor Array to monitor oxygen levels.
The Oxygen Control Unit depends on the Oxygen Supply Line for regulated oxygen supply to the distribution manifold.
The Oxygen Sensor Array is associated with the Oxygen Control Unit for sensor feedback and system adjustments.
The Oxygen Distribution Manifold is composed of various ducting and flow regulation components ensuring uniform oxygen delivery.
The Emergency Oxygen Delivery System is linked to the Oxygen Control Unit to enable rapid activation during critical conditions.
The Oxygen Supply Line aggregates conditioned oxygen for distribution to both standard and emergency subsystems.

systemComponents.description: Central electronic module responsible for processing sensor data, managing oxygen flow regulation, and interfacing with cockpit displays.
systemComponents.name: Oxygen Control Unit

subComponents.description: Graphical display and control interface for monitoring oxygen system parameters and alarms.
subComponents.name: User Interface Module

subComponents.description: Communication module that facilitates data exchange between sensors and system controllers.
subComponents.name: Communication Module

systemComponents.description: Pipeline infrastructure that regulates the flow of oxygen from storage to distribution points.
systemComponents.name: Oxygen Supply Line

subComponents.description: Flow regulator that adjusts the rate of oxygen delivery in response to system commands.
subComponents.name: Flow Regulator

subComponents.description: Pressure valve to maintain required supply pressure and prevent over-pressurization in the lines.
subComponents.name: Pressure Valve

systemComponents.description: A comprehensive array of sensors that continuously sample the oxygen concentration and other related parameters.
systemComponents.name: Oxygen Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Sensor that accurately measures the concentration of oxygen in the supply line.
subComponents.name: Oxygen Concentration Sensor

systemComponents.description: System component responsible for distributing conditioned oxygen evenly throughout the passenger cabin.
systemComponents.name: Oxygen Distribution Manifold

subComponents.description: Primary distribution duct that ensures balanced oxygen delivery to different cabin zones.
subComponents.name: Primary Manifold

subComponents.description: Secondary flow branches for regulated oxygen delivery to critical areas.
subComponents.name: Secondary Branches

systemComponents.description: Backup system designed to provide emergency oxygen delivery in case of primary system failure.
systemComponents.name: Emergency Oxygen Delivery System

subComponents.description: Emergency mask deployment unit designed for rapid oxygen delivery to passengers.
subComponents.name: Emergency Mask Deployment

subComponents.description: Backup oxygen storage tank ensuring availability of oxygen during system disruptions.
subComponents.name: Backup Supply Tank

dependencies.name: Oxygen System satisfies Oxygen Pressure Requirement

requirements.name: Oxygen Pressure Requirement
requirements.text: The oxygen system shall maintain the oxygen pressure within safe limits.
